subject: Re: [junit] Best practices for parameterizing JUnit executions?
messageBody:
> "How do I pass command-line arguments to a test execution?"

> For example, I'm running a test that does something with a file. I'd
> like to make the filename configurable, not hardcoded, so that
> the test can be run with different inputs.

Typically you would use '-D' options when launching the java VM. But it gets
rapidely crowdy when you have several of these options.

Take a look at the XMLPropertyManager or PropertyManager classes of the
JUnit-addons package (http://junit-addons.sf.net). These class allow you to
define a property file (or XML file) containing well, properties. You can
access these properties within your tests by calling
XMLPropertymanager.getProperty(key).

-Vladimir
